title: Elon Musk isn't giving you crypto - it's a scam
description: The old "give 1 BTC to Elon, get 2 back" scam is back, so beware.

title: Amazon Echo Show 15 finally becomes the kitchen TV it always wanted to be
description: The update adds support for Amazon Fire TV and spatial audio processing for improved audio.

title: Proton's encrypted cloud storage is going mobile
description: Proton Drive is now available on iOS and Android devices, with other platform releases planned soon.

title: Pentagon awards $9bn cloud contract to Google, Oracle, Amazon and Microsoft
description: Often conbative cloud providers will need to collaborate to deliver the Pentagon’s cloud strategy.

title: Campfire Audio wants to enter your Orbit with its first ever true wireless earbuds
description: The aspirational audio brand has finally dipped its toes into the wire-free market, with new Bluetooth 5.2 buds that boast 10mm dynamic drivers.

title: Bioshock 4 isn't dead, it just got a key lead dev from Ghost of Tsushima and Far Cry 4
description: One of the writers behind Far Cry 4 and Ghost of Tsushima just signed on to be narrative lead of Bioshock 4.

title: Future MacBook Pros could ditch the keyboard in favor of a big foldable screen
description: The possibility of a foldable MacBook Pro is something we heard about earlier this year.

title: Google Sheets want to use AI to flag and fix your mistakes
description: Google’s TensorFlow team will let users harness the power of AI to fix annoying spreadsheet mistakes or make predictions.

title: Intel set to reveal PC roadmap – will we hear about new CPUs?
description: Maybe we’ll learn more about Lunar Lake, or even the future processors beyond that…

title: Praise the Saints! Shadow and Bone season 2 finally has a release date
description: Netflix has officially revealed when Shadow and Bone season 2 will be released.

title: Microsoft Teams wants to build an all-new workplace community for your business
description: Microsoft Teams takes aim at the group chat market with communities designed for managing groups and clubs.

title: It looks like Sony's accidentally leaked the Street Fighter 6 release date
description: The release date for Street Fighter 6 has been leaked ahead of The Game Awards.

title: I'll crash straight into the sun with this Meta Quest 2 game's hand-tracked controls
description: The new Stellaris VR spin-off will make use of Hand Tracking 2.0 to put the weight of the solar system in your hands.

title: Apple announces huge upgrade to your iCloud data privacy
description: New Apple security tools help protect both public figures and regular consumers against cyberattackers.

title: Google says North Korea targeted an Internet Explorer zero-day vulnerability
description: Internet Explorer may have officially been retired, but it's still used by Office, Google researchers found.

title: This report claims to have found the seven keys to a secure business
description: Cisco scores businesses on security resilience and reveals the high achievers’ secrets.

title: Scammers are attacking each other with some very old-school tools
description: Scammers target scammers with typosquatting, phishing, and malware, researchers are saying.

title: The Witcher 3's next-gen update may look better, but you'll pay for it in broken mods
description: The Witcher 3 Next Gen will look even better thanks to these baked-in community mods, but your others might get broken.

title: Sonos and IKEA’s latest Symfonisk collab is yet another lamp-speaker hybrid
description: Sonos and IKEA have created a new speaker-furnishing hybrid: the Symfonisk Floor Lamp speaker.

title: PS5 supply issues are 'resolved' in Asia, but what about the US and the UK?
description: SIE President and CEO Jim Ryan has stated that the company has 'resolved' PS5 supply issues in Japan and Asia.

title: Look away, Canon fans: Sigma could soon announce lenses for the Nikon Z mount
description: Sigma is rumored to be launching new lenses for Nikon's mirrorless cameras soon. Will it force Canon to change its mind?

title: Web skimming hackers infiltrate over 40 ecommerce websites - that we know of
description: Web skimming or Magecart is used to access sensitive information from websites through various hacking methods.

title: Apple really wants you to use a physical security key for Apple ID
description: Not its own security key, though, but rather a third-party solution.

title: Boost Infinite is finally here, and it offers unlimited data for just $25 per month
description: Boost Infinite will give you unlimited data, minutes and texts for just $25 per month – forever.

title: Ask these questions before you make your Lensa Magic Avatars
description: Lensa Magic Avatars are all good clean fun, until someone gets hurt. Ask these questions first.

title: Dyson's air-purifying ANC headphones are really coming to market next year
description: Dyson has revealed the specifications of its noise-cancelling headphones with wearable purifier attachment due in 2023.
